message.raw:
Modify LightCrafter to round up to a multiple of four images that it sends
to the DMD - even though they do not have triggers.

For the model we have, it is a requirement when the number of images is > 24
that there must be a multiple of 2 images, and when > 48, a multiple of four.
We just round up to a multiple of four always.

message.raw:
Ignore ports with no lines in manual mode.

This prevents a crash due to the NI_PCI_6534 having zero lines on port 4.
We could have had the introspection code ingore ports with no lines, but then
the port numbers would not be contiguous, since this device has a port 5.
Easier for now to keep the assumption of contiguous port numbers and simply not
use the ports with no lines. But we may revisit this if there are further
issues with this phantom port 4.

message.raw:
Use a multiple-of-four number of samples per chan to test digital ports, as some
models (observed with PCI 6534) require this.

Use a whole digital port instead of just one line, as some
models (also PCI 6534) require this. Catch errors about requiring multiple ports
at a time for 653x models, and return True since these models do support
buffered output despite these other requirements.

The devices that require the number of samples per channel to be a multiple of
four may be a problem in labscript, since labscript does not know or care about
such requirements presently.

message.raw:
Use David Meyer's technique of iterating over all baud rates at startup if
communication cannot be established at the current baud rate.

This resolves an issue whereby restarting a tab in BLACS does not cleanly shut
it down, and so the Novatech's baud rate would not be reset to te default value
upon restart. The startup code would then not be able to communicate with it.

BLACS should try to cleanly shut down tabs upon restart, if possible, but
that is a separate issue.

message.raw:
Rename submodules of dummy pseudoclock to all be plural.
This is a better precedent for devices to use, as all submodules can follow
the same naming convention and not have to rename from singular to plural
if they grow an extra class.

message.raw:
Updates after testing in the lab (made all labscript and BLACS parameters correctly reference clock frequency)

* Added the automatic creation of a `WaitMonitor` so that you don't have to remember the syntax (since it's a bit meaningless for this device)
* Added a configurable trigger debouce parameter
* Waits (and inbuilt wait monitor) have been tested and work. The measured wait duration appears reasonably accurate, but it's hard to tell without a function generator that is referenced to a common 10MHz signal and is capable of producing a delayed pulse and ensuring that we account correctly for output delays in NI cards, etc. etc). I have no reason to doubt it's accuracy though as it literally just counts internal clock ticks while it waits.
* External referencing of the entire device was tested successfully (and is necessary if using it with other pseudoclocks, much like the PineBlaster). I tested with both a 33.333MHz reference and a 50MHz reference signal produced by a NB3N502 chip. The OpalKelly board stayed synchronised with our PulseBlasters that were similarly referenced to a common 10MHz GPS source.

TODO:
 * confirm it works as a secondary pseudoclock

message.raw:
Work around the "digital outputs all being zero crashes DAQmx" issue differently
by running DO as static if DOs are all zero. This removes the requirement to
have dummy DO just to avoid this issue, including in connecition tables where
usually there are no user-given instructions.

The downside to this is the beginning of output will not be in-time with the
pseudoclock, instead it will be in software time beforehand.
Some other devices are implemented this way too though, so perhaps we are not
making any guarantees about this in any case.

waiting for the wait durations to be processed, because the wait monitor worker
would not even run its transition_to_manual method until after the acquisition
worker had finished transitioning to manual.

message.raw:
Always write using WriteDigitalU32 regardless of port size.
This works around both a bug in WriteDigitalLines, see:
  #!/labscript_suite/labscript_devices/pull-requests/56/#comment-83671312
as well as a bug where with some boards smaller integer write methods throw an
error even though they are the correct size for the port, see here:
 https://forums.ni.com/t5/Multifunction-DAQ/problem-with-correlated-DIO-on-USB-6341/td-p/3344066

message.raw:
RFBlaster changes:
* Use logging from labscript_utils.
* Fix global import of socket in __init__.
* Fix attempt to netcat using self.address, which had protocol prefix and port.
* Fixed reconnect loop (while should only be conditional on whether it worked).
* Reset connection attempts after successful kloned restart over netcat.

message.raw:
Attempt to implement multiple connection attempts and web server restart on the
rfBlaster. This requires respawning netcat upon each connection. Standalone test
script in RFBlaster_kloned.py. New method restart_kloned called by all methods
that make urllib2.urlopen calls; transition_to_buffered, check_remote_values, &
program_manual. A fair bit of boilerplate here, with the only thing differing
being the actual request.

message.raw:
* This script requires Python >= 3.6, so assert this and omit PY2 conditional.
* Handle premature calls to transition_to_static.
* Don't use experiment stop_time to set acquisition timeout, as doing so delays
  the loop in grab_multiple, and thus the effect of camera.abort_acquisition().
  Acquisition timeouts greater than 5s are likely to cause Camera.abort()
  to timeout, crashing the device tab of the camera.
* Print statement at end of grab_multiple reports "M of N frames".
* If the acquisition thread is alive when transition_to_static is called, call
  abort() (since we are not returning the incomplete list of images anyway).
* Fixed bug in abort where camera._abort_acquisition wasn't being reset, leading
  to erroneous abort in subsequent shot(s).
* Removed extraneous commented code.

values.message:
* This script requires Python >= 3.6, so assert this and omit PY2 conditional.
* Handle premature calls to transition_to_static.
* Don't use experiment stop_time to set acquisition timeout, as doing so delays
  the loop in grab_multiple, and thus the effect of camera.abort_acquisition().
  Acquisition timeouts greater than 5s are likely to cause Camera.abort()
  to timeout, crashing the device tab of the camera.
* Print statement at end of grab_multiple reports "M of N frames".
* If the acquisition thread is alive when transition_to_static is called, call
  abort() (since we are not returning the incomplete list of images anyway).
* Fixed bug in abort where camera._abort_acquisition wasn't being reset, leading
  to erroneous abort in subsequent shot(s).
* Removed extraneous commented code.

message.raw:
IMAQdx_Camera:
* Permit float type in set_attribute.

IMAQdxCameraServer:
* Added image_path, named_exposures, and imageify kwargs.
* Fixed bug in transition_to_buffered (cam should be self.camera)
* transition_to_static:
   - Base image path in h5 file on image_path prefix
   - Append orientation to image path (camera_name if orientation unspecified)
   - Add IMAQdx attributes ExposureTimeAbs, Width, Height, & Binning parameters
     (if they exist) to the image group.
   - Save separate datasets for each named frame if named_exposures is True.
   - Use HDF5 image attributes to make images viewable in HDFView if imageify.

General:
* kwargs for IMAQdxCameraServer pulled from LabConfig (optional).
* Code cleanup including path, year, and authors in header.

message.raw:
transition_to_buffered:
* Define exposures attribute to be used by transition_to_static when saving
  images by name.
* Use labscript_utils to get device_properties.
* Attempt to get stop time of experiment by walking the device heirarchy, to
  inform acquisition timeout.
* Set exposure time and acquisition timeout explicitly, and any IMAQdx
  properties specified in added_properties.
* Get exposure_time, width, height (mandatory) and binning and pixel format
  (optional) to write as per-shot attributes in transition_to_static.

message.raw:
Fixed bug in get_capabilties in port_supports_buffered().
The function previously did not correctly retry different clocking terminals
if the first one it tried did not support being used as an external clock.

Reran get_capabilties.py and generate_subclasses.py to fix incorrectly detected
capabiltiies of NI-PXIe_6535 resulting from the bug.
